effect.text: Play Clefairy Doll as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Clefairy Doll counts as a Pokémon (instead of a Trainer card). Clefairy Doll has no attacks, can't retreat, and can't be Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. If Clefairy Doll is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Clefairy Doll.

tips: Use to stall while setting up
Doesn't give up a prize when knocked out
Can voluntarily discard before your attack
Absorb damage from powerful attacks without losing Prize advantage
Force opponent to waste resources on a target that yields no Prize

rulings.ruling: Clefairy Doll counts as a Pokémon while in play for all game purposes (can be targeted by Gust of Wind, counts toward bench limit, etc.)
When Clefairy Doll is knocked out, it goes to the discard pile but does not award a Prize card to the opponent
You can voluntarily discard Clefairy Doll during your turn before your attack, but not at other times
Clefairy Doll cannot retreat because it has no retreat cost and no ability to pay one
You need Switch or similar effects to move Clefairy Doll from the active position
Clefairy Doll cannot be affected by Special Conditions (Sleep, Confusion, Paralysis, Poison)
Alakazam can use Damage Swap to move damage counters to or from Clefairy Doll since it counts as a Pokémon
Defender and PlusPower can be attached to Clefairy Doll
If Clefairy Doll is in the active position and you have no benched Pokémon when it's knocked out, you lose the game
Clefairy Doll cannot attack, even if it somehow gained an attack through other card effects
